ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: to bring you all the skilled magicians.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: To bring all the wise magicians to you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: to summon every skilful magician to your presence.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: to bring together at the Pharaohs court all the skillful magicians.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “To bring all the expert magicians to you.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: That they bring to you all well-versed sorcerers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: That they may bring to you every enchanter possessed of knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: to bring thee every cunning sorcerer.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: To bring each knowing wizard unto thee.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: who should bring to you every skillful magician."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: That they may bring to thee every magician knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: to bring you every expert magician.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: That they bring up to you all well-versed sorcerers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: to summon every wellversed sorcerer to you'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “And let them bring you every skillful magician.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Who will bring you every learned magician."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [7:112] to bring you every cunning sorcerer’ (sāhir: a variant reading has sahhār) to outdo Moses in the art of magic. And so they summoned [them].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (To bring each knowing wizard) who is proficient in wizardry (unto thee).
